availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Harvey Harris (Jefferson County, Indiana, book rubber and soldier. Military mayor of Memphis, 1864-1865.)

body.p: Jefferson County, Indiana, book rubber and soldier. Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Eliza Sullivan Harris. Father of Margaret Harris. Bookkeeper in Jefferson County, Indiana in 1860. Served as a captain and lieutenant colonel assigned as an Assistant Adjutant General of Volunteers in the Union Army's XVI Corps from July 17, 1862 to August 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Jefferson County, Madison, p. 442.
"Col. Thomas H. Harris Dead," The Rushville Republican ( Rushville, IN), August 28, 1896, p. 4.
Francis B Heitman, Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from its Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903 vol. 1, pt. II (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1903), 504.
